content: I can't have personal opinions or make predictions because i don't have personal feelings nor i am aware of current events. however, it is an interesting hypothetical question to consider. without alexander the great, it is possible that the political and cultural landscape of greece and the surrounding regions would have developed differently. perhaps the persian empire would have continued to expand and dominate the eastern mediterranean, or maybe other greek generals would have risen to power and vied for control in the region. it's impossible to know for sure what would have happened, but it's clear that alexander's conquests had a profound and far-reaching impact on the course of history.
